alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:32AM EDT until May 01 at 9:50PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine...New Hampshire... Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Franklin, Oxford and Androscoggin Counties. Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Sagadahoc and Androscoggin Counties. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. For the Androscoggin River...including Gorham, Rumford, Auburn... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Warner River...including Davisville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Androscoggin River at Rumford. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding begins at Bethel Campgrounds. At 13.4 feet, Flooding begins at the ballfield south of Lincoln Avenue in Rumford. At 13.7 feet, The ballfield south of Lincoln Avenue (Route 2) in Rumford completely floods. At 15.0 feet, Low spots flood along the Swift and Androscoggin Rivers in Mexico and Rumford. At 15.5 feet, Water rises to the intersection of Lincoln Avenue (Route 2) and Falmouth Street. At 16.0 feet, Water flows across Route 2 at Falmouth Street and into Hosmer Field Athletic Complex. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 15.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
